articles.author: Mike Stone, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The decision is a major change in U.S. policy and comes as Donald Trump, who has promised to limit further support for Ukraine, prepares to take office.
articles.title: Biden allows Ukraine to use US arms to strike inside Russia

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: As losses mount and exhaustion sets in, both sides in the war are trying to replace humans with machines.
articles.title: How 1,000 days of conflict evolved into robot war between Russia and Ukraine

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies were set to meet on Monday in Brazil for their annual summit, bracing for a shift in the global order with the return to power of U.S. president-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: G20 summit confronts a global order unsettled by Trump's return

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said it conducted strikes on "terrorist targets" in Beit Lahiya.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 14 Palestinians in Gaza, some in attacks on tents, say medics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile attack killed eight people and wounded 39 in Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday, local governor Oleh Kiper said.
articles.title: Russian missile attack on Ukraine's Odesa kills eight, injures 39, governor says

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Max Hunder, Lili Bayer
articles.description: The U.S. decision to authorise long-range Ukrainian strikes could help Kyiv defend the foothold in Russia's Kursk region that it seized as leverage in any war talks, but may come too late to change the course of the war, analysts said.
articles.title: Long-range strikes against Russia: too late to save Ukraine?

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: A U.S. envoy is due in Lebanon on Tuesday for talks on a ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah, with Beirut positive about Washington's efforts to end the war but seeking changes to a proposal on how to monitor a truce, a senior Lebanese official said.
articles.title: US envoy expected in Beirut in bid to advance ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Tae-yul said on Monday he is "strongly confident" the South Korea-U.S. alliance will continue to thrive under the incoming U.S. administration of President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: South Korea 'strongly confident' US alliance will thrive under Trump

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Russia on Monday vetoed a United Nations Security Council draft resolution that called on Sudan's warring parties to cease hostilities immediately and ensure the delivery of humanitarian aid.
articles.title: Russia vetoes UN Security Council action on Sudan war

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The only alternative to the U.N. Palestinian relief agency in Gaza is to allow Israel to run services there, its chief said on Monday, repeating calls for states to resist an Israeli ban.
articles.title: No alternative to UNRWA in Gaza besides Israel, agency chief says
